abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of Second Education
            Quality Improvement Project (EQIP II) is to promote
            excellence in teaching, and learning throughout the school
            sector, while continuing to foster the inclusion of all
            children at all levels of the basic education system.
            Progress against this objective is measured by age-based
            school enrolment rates, disaggregated by gender.
            Nonetheless, school construction will potentially affect the
            environment, thus, to this end, this environmental
            assessment presents the following mitigation measures.
            Appropriate site selection will be taken into account,
            including measures to avoid as possible deforestation, or
            vegetation degradation, to be followed when necessary with
            vegetative propagation practices. During construction, to
            minimize air pollution, construction sites should be
            regularly sprayed, and materials adequately stored; water
            sources will be protected to avoid contamination, while oil
            spills shall be disposed of in accordance with standard
            regulations; adequate working schedules should minimize
            noise disturbances; solid wastes shall be disposed of at
            selected sites, or incinerated, and, - in collaboration with
            local authorities - effluents will be controlled, and
            treated per standard regulations, while septic tanks will be
            installed as needed. Road signaling, and appropriate detours
            will ensure traffic safety.
